Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with Harpocrates wearing a hemhemet crown, flanked by Isis-Thermuthis (or Agathe Tyche) and Sarapis-Agathodaimon. At the rear is an Egyptian ring handle. The angular shoulder is decorated with a raised point on each side of the handle, and three more between the nozzle and the discus. Within the raised base is an impressed Greek name and a branch. Covered with a brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2043)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine (trustees)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
